result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LARRY W. HOOD

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant LARRY W. HOOD in court.  Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court for LARRY W. HOOD.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court verifies address/phone number - no change.  Bond Continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOL.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  DO NOT OPERATE A MOTOR VEHICLE WITHOUT A VALID LICENSE  You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.  Due to COVID-19 you will need to call 920-236-4906 BEFORE reporting.

2:43 PM Defendant LARRY W. HOOD appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ty Gasparek appeared by video for LARRY W. HOOD.  Prosecuting attorney Eric Sparr in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 245
Bail/bond hearing on September 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
for Alcohol 24/7 Monitoring Program Violation Bond Review

11:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant LARRY W. HOOD in court.  Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court for LARRY W. HOOD.   Information received by Defendant, waives formal reading and enters a not guilty plea.   The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. Address/phone verified - no change.  Bond continues.

10:00 AM Defendant LARRY W. HOOD in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Eric Sparr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony taken.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed.  Defendant bound over for trial.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 10:22.  Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:20 AM Defendant LARRY W. HOOD in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Set for Prelim.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 9:21.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
